headline: Cheney, Kinzinger Censured by RNC as Trump Rift Widens
author: Siobhan Hughes
sentences:
The resolution accuses the lawmakers of disloyalty, alleging they have demonstrated, with actions and words, that they support Democrat efforts to destroy President Trump more than they support winning back a Republican majority in 2022.?
By serving on the Jan. 6 committee, the resolution said, Ms. Cheney and Mr. Kinzinger are participating in a Democrat-led persecution of ordinary citizens engaged in legitimate political discourse.?
On Jan. 6, supporters of Mr. Trump stormed the Capitol in an effort to block the certification of President Biden's victory by Congress.

tweeted: The RNC is censuring Liz Cheney and Adam Kinzinger because they are trying to find out what happened on January 6thHUH?? Sen. Mitt Romney (R., Utah) tweeted: Shame falls on a party that would censure persons of conscience, who seek truth in the face of vitriol.?

Mr. Kinzinger, who isn't running for re-election, said his fellow Republicans have allowed conspiracies and toxic tribalism [to] hinder their ability to see clear-eyed.?

Outside the Capitol during the siege, some rioters could be heard chanting Hang Mike Pence.? Mr. Pence defied the pressure campaign to reject electors from six states challenged by Republicans: Arizona, Georgia, Michigan, Nevada, Pennsylvania and Wisconsin.

Republicans rebuked two House lawmakers for serving on the select committee investigating the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the U.S. Capitol, as the GOP continues to grapple with former President Donald Trump's failed effort to overturn the 2020 election result.

Mr. Kellogg told investigators that on the morning of the attack, Mr. Trump was on the phone with Mr. Pence and told him you're not tough enough to make the call? to overturn the election, according to testimony from Mr. Kellogg.

He has previously said that the Constitution provides the vice president with no authority to reject or return electoral votes certified by states and had called the notion that he could overturn a result un-American.

A resolution calling for the censure of Reps. Liz Cheney of Wyoming and Adam Kinzinger of Illinois passed in a voice vote during a meeting of the Republican National Committee in Salt Lake City on Friday.

Photos: Getty Images
The Democratic-led House created the Jan. 6 committee last year after Republicans blocked an effort to set up a bipartisan commission based on the model of the Sept. 11 investigation.

The panel has also expressed interest in speaking with former Vice President Mike Pence, who oversaw the certification process and rejected pressure by Mr. Trump to reject some pivotal states' results.
While Mr. Pence hasn't been issued a subpoena from the select committee, several of his former aides have testified, most recently former adviser Marc Short and Mr. Pence's former lawyer, Greg Jacob.
The action comes as the party is split over Mr. Trump's past actions and future influence over the party, headed into a midterm election in which the GOP hopes to regain control of Congress.

Photo: Bridget Bennett/Bloomberg News
The Jan. 6 committee has sought testimony and documents from numerous officials close to Mr. Trump, zeroing in on his communications that day.
The focus on Mr. Pence comes as members of the Jan. 6 committee have raised the possibility of referring their findings to the Justice Department for possible criminal prosecution.
Ahead of the vote, Ms. Cheney, who had previously been stripped of her House GOP leadership role and faces a primary challenge this year, brushed off the censure attempt.

 A year after pro-Trump rioters attacked the U.S. Capitol, lawmakers and Americans remain divided over what happened on Jan. 6, 2021, and who is to blame.
A bipartisan group of senators is working on revising the Electoral College Act, which governs how Congress counts and certifies presidential election results.

At one point, Mr. Trump told the vice president that I hope you're going to stand up for the good of our Constitution and for the good of our country.
